SENT.plain: Internuclear ophthalmoplegia (INO) is a complex ocular motility disorder caused by damage to the medial longitudinal fasciculus
The occurrence of hemi-seesaw nystagmus in an INO patient has been reported rarely
This nystagmus may be caused by damage to the pathway from the contralateral vertical semicircular canal
The ocular tilt reaction is characterized by ipsilateral head and neck tilt, skew deviation, and ocular torsion
We report a patient who presented with hemi-seesaw nystagmus, ocular tilt reaction, and limb ataxia combined with an INO from a right focal pontine infarction
INO may be accompanied by a variety of ocular findings associated with the disruption of the medial longitudinal fasciculus
